page.title: 17THE RAF IN HARPUR HILL
page.content:
{ The RAF base established here during World War 2 had left many marks on the area. The RAF made tunnels in the limestone to store bombs & ammunition. There are stories that they even stored them in the fields but the Germans did not find out and did not bomb the area even though it was an important target. Later the tunnels were used to grow mushrooms and now they are used as a cold store.
The buildings of the base are now used by High Peak College and the houses which were built for the men are used now by some college personel and some are privately owned. Some of the roads are named after famous members of the RAF, such as{Trenchard Drive}and {Harris Road.}
